channel.title: Comments on: Which Android Phone Is For Me?

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: I will regret it every month when I look at my sky high bill!
item.content:encoded: I will regret it every month when I look at my sky high bill!

item.title: By: Phil Rae (NetInspired)
item.dc:creator: Phil Rae (NetInspired)
item.description: Go-on... just get an iPhone. You won't regret it ;-)
item.content:encoded: Go-on… just get an iPhone. You won’t regret it ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: There are rumors of a GSM version of the Droid floating around but I wouldn't hold my breath about it reaching the states anytime soon.
item.content:encoded: There are rumors of a GSM version of the Droid floating around but I wouldn’t hold my breath about it reaching the states anytime soon.

item.title: By: Tony Primerano
item.dc:creator: Tony Primerano
item.description: I've been waiting for the perfect android/(monthly price) combination. Hopefully, the droid will be available on other networks soon, or have a better price. :-\ I currenly pay $5/month for a virgin mobile phone.. $90/month is a big jump. ;-)
item.content:encoded: I’ve been waiting for the perfect android/(monthly price) combination. Hopefully, the droid will be available on other networks soon, or have a better price. :-\ I currenly pay $5/month for a virgin mobile phone.. $90/month is a big jump. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: RA
item.dc:creator: RA
item.description:
I'm with you on the current state of Android hardware. Moto Droid looks good, but I like Tmo's cheap plans.
By the way, I loved my old Dash as well, but only after upgrading to Windows Mobile 6.0! It makes a big difference. It's a free upgrade from T-Mobile. http://www.t-mobile.com/WMupgrade/
Hey, maybe someday we'll be able just to run Android on our Dashes! http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=435934
item.content:encoded:
I’m with you on the current state of Android hardware. Moto Droid looks good, but I like Tmo’s cheap plans.

By the way, I loved my old Dash as well, but only after upgrading to Windows Mobile 6.0! It makes a big difference. It’s a free upgrade from T-Mobile. http://www.t-mobile.com/WMupgrade/

Hey, maybe someday we’ll be able just to run Android on our Dashes! http://forum.xda-developers.co.....p?t=435934
